intro: Schmidelia nuonensis, commonly known as the Nuonensis Schmidelia, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its unique, showy flowers that are typically red or orange in color. The plant has small, ovate leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in primary forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Schmidelia nuonensis is considered a vulnerable species.
